Thoroughbred racing betting in Australia is a popular form of gambling that involves placing wagers on the outcome of horse races. This type of betting is deeply ingrained in Australian culture, with numerous events and bet types available to enthusiasts.

== Major Racing Carnivals ==
Australia hosts several major thoroughbred racing carnivals throughout the year, attracting both local and international attention. These carnivals are significant events in the racing calendar and include:

* '''Melbourne Spring Racing Carnival''': Known for the prestigious Melbourne Cup, this carnival takes place in Victoria during October and November.
* '''Sydney Autumn Racing Carnival''': Held in New South Wales, this carnival features major races such as the Golden Slipper Stakes.
* '''Queensland Winter Racing Carnival''': Occurring in the cooler months, this carnival includes the Stradbroke Handicap.

== Melbourne Cup ==
The Melbourne Cup is Australia's most famous horse race and is held annually on the first Tuesday of November at Flemington Racecourse in Melbourne. Known as "the race that stops a nation," it is a 3,200-meter race for thoroughbreds aged three years and older. The Melbourne Cup is the highlight of the Melbourne Spring Racing Carnival and attracts a large number of bettors.

== Bet Types ==
In thoroughbred racing betting, various bet types are available, allowing punters to choose based on their preferences and strategies. Common bet types include:

* '''Win''': Betting on a horse to finish first.
* '''Place''': Betting on a horse to finish in the top three.
* '''Each-Way''': A combination of win and place bets.
* '''Quinella''': Picking the first two finishers in any order.
* '''Exacta''': Picking the first two finishers in the exact order.
* '''Trifecta''': Picking the first three finishers in the exact order.
